sentences.english: She is clothed with strength and dignity; she can laugh at the days to come.
sentences.chinese: 能力和威儀是她的衣服，她想到日後的景況就喜笑。

sentences.english: A person in authority, with authority, speaks slowly.
sentences.chinese: 權威人士及威儀之人往往語速比較慢。

sentences.english: He not the Nu speak to take a light reputation from the Wei.
sentences.chinese: 他不怒自威，說話帶着一股淡淡的威儀。

sentences.english: A giant granite horse that graced an emperor's palace.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花崗岩駿馬爲皇家宮殿平添幾分威儀。

sentences.english: She is clothed with strength and dignity, and she laughs without fear of the future.
sentences.chinese: 她以能力和威儀爲衣服，想到日後的幸福就歡笑。

sentences.english: To increase your altitude or set off your dignified manner.
sentences.chinese: 增加你的高度，襯托你的威儀。

definition: an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
rotating disk/wheel/rotor/cycle of reincarnation in Buddhism
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
